messageBody:
I think that there would be some unhappy JUnit users out there if we
got one instance shared between all tests in the class. The reason is
that JUnit tests have always been isolated an we have come to expect
that to be the case. It is quite convenient not to have to worry about
restoring state between testruns so that testB can never fail because
testA failed to clean after iteself (or that testB does not run
because it expects testA to have run which makes it fail in
isolation). Tests are of course not completely isolated anyway since
you can write to the filesystem and mutate static data but a new
instance each time sure helps.

I wouldn't mind if it would be possible to share an instance (after
all I don't have to use it if I don't want to) but I think such a
functionality should be the exception rather than the norm. One way to
treat such an exception would be to annotate the testclass as a shared
fixture or something:

@SharedFixture
@RunOrder(AsDeclared.class)
public class SomeTest {
...
}

But maybe I'm getting ahead of things, what would be the problem the
above would solve?

/J
